column1: 1224#Robert Grosseteste (Master of the School of Oxford since 1208)
1280#John de Pontissara / John of Pontoise (Bishop of Winchester)
1244#Roger de Rowell or Rodwell or Rodewell
1397#Henry Beaufort (afterwards Bishop of Lincoln and Winchester)
1403#Robert Alum or Hallam (afterwards Bishop of Salisbury)
1413#William Barrow (afterwards Bishop of Bangor and of Carlisle)
1453#George Neville (afterwards Bishop of Exeter and York; Chancellor of England)
1494#John Morton (while also Archbishop of Canterbury and Chancellor of England)

column2: 4th Earl of Pembroke (to his death on 23 January 1649)
1st Baron Curzon of Kedleston (Earl Curzon of Kedleston from 1911; Marquess Curzon of Kedleston from 1921)
1st Viscount Cave; see University of Oxford Chancellor election
1st Baron Irwin (Viscount Halifax from 1934; Earl of Halifax from 1944) (1933–1959)

column1: 1960#Harold Macmillan (Earl of Stockton from 1984) (1960–1986); see University of Oxford Chancellor election
1987#Roy Jenkins (Baron Jenkins of Hillhead from 1987) (1987–2003); see University of Oxford Chancellor election
2003#Chris Patten (Baron Patten of Barnes from 2005) (2003–); see University of Oxford Chancellor election
